item.title: about me
item.description: current assistant professor of statistics Econometric Institute, Erasmus School of Economics, Erasmus University Rotterdam past research fellow of statistics Department of Law and Economics, UnitelmaSapienza University of Rome education dutch university teaching qualification (BKO) Risbo - Erasmus University Rotterdam (expected 2022) phd in methodological statistics at La Sapienza University of Rome (2020) msc in statistics and decision sciences at La Sapienza University of Rome (2016) bsc in statistics at La Sapienza University of Rome (2013) awards and grants research grant for junior researcher “Avvio alla ricerca” (2017) award in Stats under the Stars (an Italian Statistical Society competition): best report (2017) phd scholarishp (3 years) at La Sapienza University of Rome (2016) academic services programme committee member of the conference CLADAG 2023 (2023) session organizer and chair of the “CMStatistics 2022: 15th International Conference of the ERCIM WG on Computational and Methodological Statistics” (2022) session organizer and chair of the “ECDA 2022: European Conference on Data Analysis” (2022) co-editor of “Book of Short Papers of SIS 2022” (2022) national coordinator (2022) and member of the national board of young SIS (2021-2022) programme committee member of “SIS 2022: the 51st Scientific Meeting of the Italian Statistical Society” (2022) programme committee member of the conference “IES 2022: Innovation and Society 5.

item.title: events
item.description: future conferences CMStatistics 2022: 15th International Conference of the ERCIM WG on Computational and Methodological Statistics (December 17-19, 2022) ECDA 2022: European Conference on Data Analysis (September 14-16, 2022) IFCS 2022: 17th conference of the International Federation of Classification Societies (July 19-23, 2022) SIS 2022: 51st Scientific Meeting of the Italian Statistical Society (June 22-24, 2022) EcoSta 2022: 5th International Conference on Econometrics and Statistics (June 4-6, 2022) recent events IES 2022: Innovation and Society 5.

item.title: materials and info
item.description: I am a statistician and my research is focused on the methodological and computational aspects of data analysis. The best feeling is when I can use my knowledge to solve practical and real problems. I am currently working on latent variable models, unsupervised classification and model-based composite indicators. ongoing projects seminars and talks events teaching material

item.title: ongoing projects
item.description: my current research consists of: Hierarchical Disjoint Principal Component Analysis (Cavicchia, C., Vichi, M. and Zaccaria, G.) Revision requested A new ranking calculation based on a composite indicator model: the case of the top 20 European football teams (Cavicchia, C. and Sarnacchiaro, P.) Revision requested Hierarchical Means Clustering (Vichi, M., Cavicchia, C. and Groenen, P.J.F.) Revision requested Convex Clustering of Mixed Numerical and Categorical Data (Brink, T.

C., Provvisiero, D. P., Cavicchia, C. and Triassi, M. Spatiotemporal estimation of heavy metals Pollution in the Mediterranean Sea from Volturno River, Southern Italy: Distribution, Risk Assessment and Loads

item.title: seminars and talks
item.description: seminars and invited talks A general framework for implementing distance measures for categorical variables - IFCS 2022: 17th conference of the International Federation of Classification Societies (2022 - Porto, Portugal) Convex Clustering of Mixed Numerical and Categorical Data - EcoSta 2022: 5th International Conference on Econometrics and Statistics (2022 - Virtual) Introduction to Statistics - Series of seminars within the Hospitality Management bsc degree course of Federico II University of Naples (2022 - Virtual)

item.title: teaching material
item.description: supervisions I am currently supervising five msc theses in Econometrics, three msc theses in Data Science for Marketing Analytics and five bsc theses in Econometrics (on Cavicchia, Vichi and Zaccaria (2022)) at Erasmus School of Economics this year I am second assessor of three msc theses in Econometrics, three msc theses in Data Science for Marketing Analytics and five bsc theses in Econometrics at Erasmus School of Economics
